ARABIC: أَوَلَا يَذْكُرُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ يَكُ شَيْـًٔا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Does not man recall that We created him before when he was not anything?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does man not remember that before We created him he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Does he not remember that We created him when he did not exist?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Does not man remember that We created him before this, and he was non existent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Does not man remember that We created him before, while he was nothing
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Does not man remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Will not man remember that We created him aforetime, when he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was naught?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But does man not remember that We created him when he was nothing before?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Remembereth not man that We created him afore when he was not aught? *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Does not man remember that We created him before when he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Does not man remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Will the human not remember that We created him before when he was not a thing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Does the human being not remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:67] Does not man then remember (yadhdhakaru, is actually yatadhakkaru, but the tā’ has been changed to a dhāl and assimilated with the [other] dhāl; a variant reading leaves it as yadhkuru) that We created him before, when he was nothing?, and thus infer from the first act [of creation] the [possibility of] resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 332 (Doth not man remember) does not Ubayy Ibn Khalaf take admonition (that We created him before) this from a stinking sperm drop, (when he was naught?) Likewise, I am able to bring him back to life again.
